thread.title: ‘Back to Burgundy’ Review: Earthy, Yeasty, Lovely

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Back to Burgundy’ Review: Earthy, Yeasty, Lovely
text: Before I explain my slightly conditional affection for “Back to Burgundy” I should declare my unconditional admiration for Cédric Klapisch, the man who directed it, and who wrote it with Santiago Amigorena. With a strong sense of such traditional values as family (thus his lovely chamber piece “Family Resemblances”) and a sharpness of eye that might befit an ethnologist (his comedy “When the Cat’s Away” is as much about urban renewal and Parisian neighborhoods as it is about a lost kitty), Mr. Klapisch always has interesting things to say.
